name: Sailorbot
description:
Play it on liluo.io too

liluo.io link: https://liluo.io/jaspior/sailorbot

Help SailorBot. and its pet, Parrot.O.S. to turn on all sea pc. This game is a prototype/proof of concepts, so, while the mechanics seem to work fine, they could be more polished. I'm bad at level design, sorry

Controls:
Arrow keys: move sailorbot

e or spacebar on level selection: enter level

q: return to the level selection

spacebar or shift: jump

w: ask the parrot to wait or return to you

a: send parrot to the nearest sensor, if in range

e: activate sensors, checkpoints, and the ending of each level

r: pet the parrot s2

----------------------------------------------------

Music by Skrjablin under CC0 license. Sfx and font used by Kenney under CC0 license, all other arts done by myself.

---------------------------------------------------

This game is just a prototype/concept, I was looking to see if this engine was easy enough to recommend to people who don't know how to code. While I do prefer Godot for many reasons, GDvelop is a nice way to present game development and the engine is powerfull enough to produce full games.
